articles.title: Gray Whales Arriving Early in San Francisco Bay — Scientists Don't Know Why
articles.description: Two gray whales have been spotted exploring San Francisco Bay unusually early in February 2026. The Marine Mammal Center's team used distinct markings to identify the individuals.

articles.title: Underwater Mics and Machine Learning Aid Right Whale Conservation
articles.description: Researchers have developed a new method using underwater microphones and machine learning to estimate North Atlantic right whale numbers — a safer and more cost-effective monitoring approach.

articles.title: Scientists Harness AI to Help Protect Whales Along Atlantic Coast
articles.description: Rutgers University researchers developed an AI tool to predict endangered whale habitat, guiding ships along the Atlantic coast to avoid deadly collisions and inform conservation strategies.

articles.title: Surprise Baby Whale Sightings Reveal There's Still Much to Learn About Humpbacks
articles.description: New study highlights the critical need for increased awareness to protect newborn humpback whales throughout their winter journey north — which can span more than 2,300 kilometers.

articles.title: The Race to Save Wikie and Keijo: Mother and Son Orcas Left in Shut-Down Aquarium
articles.description: The Whale Sanctuary Project presents its plan for two orcas stranded at France's closed Marineland aquarium, facing resistance from animal welfare groups and the park's owner.

articles.title: Climate Crisis Linked to Fall in Southern Right Whale Birth Rates
articles.description: Researchers warn that declining birth rates in southern right whales across South America and South Africa signal how climate change affects krill-dependent marine life.

articles.title: New Research Uncovers Hidden Divide in West Coast Killer Whales
articles.description: Study reveals two distinct communities of transient killer whales on the West Coast inhabit very different worlds and lead distinctly different lives, with implications for conservation planning.

articles.title: Maldives Launches Tech4Nature Project to Safeguard Whale Sharks
articles.description: IUCN, Maldives government, and Huawei launch initiative to modernize management of South Ari Marine Protected Area using real-time monitoring technology to protect whale sharks.

articles.title: Endangered Whales at Risk After Trump Ends Cape Cod Sanctuary Fishing Ban
articles.description: The New England Aquarium warns that lifting the commercial fishing ban for a marine national monument off Cape Cod threatens endangered whales and the ecosystem.

articles.title: Rice's Whales: Connecticut's Responsibility and the Cost of Letting Extinction Happen
articles.description: With fewer than 100 Rice's whales remaining in the Gulf of Mexico—likely closer to 50—this species faces extinction as a policy choice unfolding in real time.

articles.title: 'Go Slow–Whales Below' Initiative Launches for Peak Hawaiian Whale Season
articles.description: The 'Go Slow – Whales Below' initiative urges mariners to exercise caution as humpback whale season reaches its peak in Hawaiian waters, following the discovery of a whale calf with propeller injuries.

articles.title: Sound Reveals the Hidden Lives of Deep-Diving Whales
articles.description: Scientists used underwater sound recordings to reconstruct 3D dive and hunting behavior of elusive beaked whales in the Gulf of Mexico.

articles.title: Right Whale Calves Return in Unusual Numbers
articles.description: Researchers surveying the Southeastern U.S. coast this winter have documented 21 North Atlantic right whale calves, offering a rare bright spot for one of the most endangered species.

articles.title: French Carrier CMA CGM Supports Right Whale Conservation Research
articles.description: French shipping company CMA CGM supports WHOI acoustic monitoring that alerts mariners to slow down when right whales are detected in shipping lanes.

articles.title: Indigenous Leaders Release Treaty Recognizing Whales as Legal Persons
articles.description: Indigenous leaders from across Polynesia released landmark treaty text recognizing whales as legal persons and ancestral beings, potentially reshaping global ocean governance.

articles.title: Whale Sharks Released from Nets as Indian Fishers Turn Rescuers
articles.description: Over a thousand whale sharks have been rescued along India's west coast as fishers voluntarily cut their nets to free trapped sharks in this community-driven conservation movement.

articles.title: A Hopeful Season: 22 North Atlantic Right Whale Calves Documented
articles.description: Researchers have documented 22 North Atlantic right whale calves this season — the highest total in 15 years, offering hope for the critically endangered species.

articles.title: Bipartisan Lawmakers Introduce Whale CHARTS Act for Whale Safety
articles.description: Rep. Doris Matsui and five colleagues introduce the Whale Conservation Habitat Analysis, Research and Technical Strategies (Whale CHARTS) Act to protect whales from ship strikes.

articles.title: Humpbacks 'Mug' Whale Watchers Off Maui in Close Encounter
articles.description: A lucky group of whale watchers off Maui got an incredible close encounter when a pair of curious humpback whales approached their boat on its way to Molokini Crater.

articles.title: Humpback Whales Confirm Stunning Comeback: 'We See Them Almost Every Day'
articles.description: Humpback whales appear to be making a remarkable comeback thanks to their dietary flexibility, according to a new study published in Marine Mammal Science.

articles.title: Right Whale and Calf Sighting Caught on Video Off Boca Grande, Florida
articles.description: The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission aerial survey team captured video of right whale 'Millipede' and her new calf approximately 5 miles east of the St. Johns River entrance.

articles.title: As the Arctic Grows Noisier, Narwhals Are Becoming Quieter
articles.description: Underwater noise pollution is forcing narwhals to reduce their vocalizations, contributing to serious impacts on the Arctic ecosystem according to Ocean Conservancy researchers.

articles.title: Critically Endangered Right Whale Found Dead Off North Carolina Coast
articles.description: The carcass of a critically endangered North Atlantic right whale was spotted about 25 miles offshore of Avon on Jan. 27, following months of failed rescue efforts after entanglement.

articles.title: Division's Final Journey: The Tragic Story of an Entangled Right Whale
articles.description: An in-depth look at the life and death of North Atlantic right whale 'Division,' spotted entangled off Jekyll Island, Georgia, whose case highlights the ongoing entanglement crisis.

articles.title: Social Smarts Help BC Humpbacks Adapt as Oceans Change
articles.description: Humpback whales on British Columbia's northwest coast are using social bonds to teach each other bubble-net feeding, a new foraging tactic that may help the whales' recovery.

articles.title: Dominica to Become Home of First Sperm Whale Reserve in 2026
articles.description: National Geographic highlights Dominica's groundbreaking plan to establish the world's first sperm whale reserve, following a young whale and its mother off the Caribbean coast.

articles.title: Greenland Declares Emergency After Orcas Spotted Near Melting Ice Shelves
articles.description: Researchers have spotted orcas breaching dangerously close to rapidly melting ice shelves, prompting emergency measures in Greenland.

articles.title: 21 Right Whale Calves Spotted on Southeast Coast Give Researchers Hope
articles.description: Scientists have spotted 21 North Atlantic right whale calves off the Southeastern coast this season — the most since 2011 — offering cautious hope for the critically endangered species.

articles.title: Whales Are Capable of Complex Communication — Could Humans Ever Talk With Them?
articles.description: New research explores how whales communicate using complex vocalizations, and whether scientists could one day bridge the communication gap between humans and cetaceans.

articles.title: 30 Years and Counting: Community Science Helps Track Humpback Whales Across Hawaiʻi
articles.description: For 30 years, volunteers across Hawaiian islands have gathered on designated coastal sites to count and track humpback whales, helping scientists assess whale distribution and abundance.

articles.title: Whale Watching in California: The Best Spots Across the Coast
articles.description: A comprehensive guide to the best whale watching locations along California's coast, from gray whales in winter to blue whales and humpbacks in summer.

articles.title: Whale Freed After Rescue Effort Off the Big Island
articles.description: Just after first light Monday morning, calm waters off Honokohau Harbor set the scene for what would become a remarkable story of survival along the Kona coast.

articles.title: Rare Whale Placenta Found Floating in Hawaiian Waters
articles.description: A 136kg whale placenta was discovered floating in Hawaiian waters — an incredibly rare find since they only remain on the surface briefly, making scientific collection almost impossible.

articles.title: Entangled Right Whale Known for Cape Cod Canal Closure Dies
articles.description: Rescue teams up and down the East Coast worked for months to try to rescue this whale. Researchers say deaths can be reduced by adopting ropeless fishing gear.

articles.title: The Complex Logistics of Moving 30 Beluga Whales
articles.description: When 30 beluga whales and four dolphins are moved from Canada's Marineland amusement park, the operation will be both a careful logistical feat and what former trainers say is a long overdue move.

articles.title: Boat Strikes Threaten Long Island Whales
articles.description: The top two threats facing whales off Long Island's coast are boat strikes and fishing nets, according to research by the Atlantic Marine Conservation Society.

articles.title: Aquariums Save Beluga Whales from Threat of Euthanasia
articles.description: Several aquariums have stepped in to rescue beluga whales that were facing potential euthanasia, providing them new homes and care.

articles.title: Oregon Implements New Rules for Crab Fishers to Reduce Whale Deaths
articles.description: The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife is implementing temporary rule changes for Dungeness crab fishers to restrict gear and areas where fishing can occur.

articles.title: 44-Year-Old Whale 'Slalom' Breaks Record with Seventh Calf
articles.description: A 44-year-old whale nicknamed 'Slalom' has given birth to her seventh calf, breaking a 15-year record for the species.

articles.title: A North Atlantic Right Whale Baby Boom Is On, But the Species Remains at Risk
articles.description: Researchers have documented nearly two dozen North Atlantic right whale calves this season. It's an encouraging sign for a species whose population is below 400.

articles.title: Canada's Marineland Whales Could Find New Homes in U.S.
articles.description: Canada's last captive whales have received a reprieve from death after the government conditionally approved a plan to export them to the United States.
